originalText.text: Taking French classes at Coucou is a dream come true.  I've been able to refresh my high school/college French in a fun and easy way.  Florian, the teacher, is simply outstanding.  He's kind, patient, and encourages each one of us.  I've already signed up for the next level!

text.text: Taking French classes at Coucou is a dream come true.  I've been able to refresh my high school/college French in a fun and easy way.  Florian, the teacher, is simply outstanding.  He's kind, patient, and encourages each one of us.  I've already signed up for the next level!

originalText.text: I took French lessons at Coucou starting from 2019  - and will continue to do so schedule allowing. This is a wonderfully run small business of hardworking, creative, and professional individuals. I recommend Coucou to for all levels of French proficiency. Its an inclusive community, and courses are well thought out, relavant, and compelling. Classes are a diverse range of backgrounds and experience - and it’s also been a great way to make new friends via a shared interest. Coucou also offers awesome supplementary programming in french (dinners, yoga, trivia etc). They doesn't just teach hours of conjugation and rules, but truly how to apply it in real life situations - and this has really set them apart. Sign up and you won’t be disappointed!

originalText.text:
Je suis tombée sur cette école complètement par hasard - and I couldn't be happier. I began at Niveau 3 and worked my way up to Niveau 6 where I'm gonna hang out for a while.
I recommend taking a few trial classes, if you can, to see which teacher might best suit your learning style. That said, they're all fabulous in their own ways. I studied with Quentin from Niveau 3-6 (fantastic teacher with enough energy to light up a city) and am beginning my studies with Anicet next.
Biggest selling points for me? - diversity of the student body (as well as the teachers), a variety of ages and experience levels, a playful and energized environment, great support from teachers in and outside of the classroom, lots of wine and cheese, and social events programmed throughout the year to provide opportunities to practice your French with fellow students.
If I were to offer one piece of advice - it's that Coucou provides a great base for learning French but most of the learning I find myself doing is outside of class. It's through reading, talking to myself at home, listening to French podcasts about subjects I enjoy, watching shows, engaging with French AI programs like Gliglish and even ChatGPT, and working with tutors on LinguaTalk and other sites that I grow. If you expect Coucou to do all the work then you might find yourself frustrated at times - but that's the nature of language learning. And this isn't to say that you have to be hyper-committed. There's something to be said for just popping into a class now and then to learn a bit about a language and a culture. :)

originalText.text: Overall, I'd say it's a great way to learn French. I liked that they offered Zoom classed which provide live interactions with both instructor and other students. However, I think there is a big difference in ability of instructors. I discovered this when I had to miss a class and was able to "take" a previously recorded class. That teacher was SO good. He explained things in both English and French; he was funny and engaging. You could tell he really wanted to you to understand. That being said, I did advance my French in my 10-week level 3 course. I will probably take level 4 next year, prior to our annual trip to France. Suggestion: I'd like to see a conversational zoom class (single session or 3 session) with each session having a topic (travel, growing up/about you, hobbies, etc) to talk about and listen to.

originalText.text: Took level 2 with Coucou. French is a beautiful, yet, difficult language and the way coucou streamlined the chapters is admirable. It makes the learning process easy and the progress visible. I loved classes with Pascal, he was kind, patient and very knowledgeable. The tips he gave helped me get my pronunciation right as well as grammar correct. Can't wait to go to next level. Highly recommend for those who want to seriously learn the beautiful French Language.
